reviews.review: Frozen 2 not only tops its predecessor but it does so easily. Yes it's music may not be as earwormy as the first soundtrack but it's music is used so cleverly and impactfully. Olaf is as funny as ever with not one joke failing and even has a somewhat catchy song. The movie started off warmly but you could feel the metaphorical storm brewing which was a nice touch. Kristoff is as worthless as ever though, only being likable in his solo "Lost In The Woods" which I even thought was a little too corny. Anna is the most important as ever though, she impacts the story in very unique and big ways. She had to make tough decisions even if it was risky or seemed wrong. She truly feels like a peer to Elsa now and not the powerless sister. Yes there are some shortcomings for sure, I think we just didn't see enough character development with the new human characters. Brunei though, he may be the best new addition to a sequel like ever, not gonna lie. He's cute, powerful, and funny. Overall this movie is a whole lot of fun, it isn't perfect but it's the most eye catching animated movie I've ever seen and has a meaningful depth filled plot.
Thought it was a more mature Disney movie, very good and entertaining but left me wondering if the kids in the cinema really understood the slightly complex storyline
Not as good as the first one but sequels are never better than the original

Great movie with lots of great scenes, but the songs did not match the level of greatness that the first movie had. Still a great movie and would recommend for all ages! Highlight of the movie was Olaf!!

Wonderful movie.  Loved how it began with the girls young and showing memories of them and their parents and explaining things from the first movie.  Will definitely be seeing it again and hope that they continue to make more movies in the series.
It was so good. The storyline was great and the animations were excellent. The songs were also really good, though it gets stuck in your head for a really long time

- Story was cool

- Characters are strong, and interesting, no one bothers or irritates you.

- The songs and score once again triumphs and stays with you after watching.

- The comedy is more than in the predecessor, but it lands and is enjoyable.

- This is some of my favourite use of magic. It's dark, but beautiful as well. It blows you away, like magic should.


- Stunning visuals, a big upgrade from the Frozen 1, and that movie's animation already was absolutely spectacular

All in all, good film, very enjoyable
You will have forgotten the songs by the time get home. The story itself is alright, but not as interesting as the original. On the plus side, the CGI is quite stunning.

Frozen 2 is the average sequel to the Box office juggernaut Frozen. I was not a fan of the first Frozen movie and clearly am not the targeted audience so maybe that is why I disliked it. The story wasn't as captivating as the original and some parts made me cringe so much. The musical aspect of the movie also lacked and clearly they tried to repeat the explosive success of Let it Go with these songs but it just fell flat. Olaf however was the saving grace for this movie as the character's extended screen time and development brought a smile to my face. Frozen is worth taking your child to see but prepare for a less than satisfying experience at the cinema
